Class Election

  • java.lang.Object
    • Election

  • public class Election
extends java.lang.Object

    Election Class

    The Election class is the main hub for the Voting System program. The Election class is initialized from the UI class. The Election class is built to manage the processing of an election, and is a source of data and operations for the STV and Plurality classes.

    Election creates a list of ballots from the given files, kicks off the process for either an STV or Plurality election respectively, and handles all of the actions surrounding writing to the audit file.

    • Method Detail

      • processElection

        public java.lang.String processElection()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method kicks off the processing of the election. This is a public method, and should be called from the UI class once the input has been confirmed.
        Returns:
        string value describing the type of election used. For testing purposed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for opening / closing files.

      • createBallotList

        public void createBallotList()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method is responsible for creating the original ballot list, by reading each ballot from files and creating new ballot objects. Upon completion of this method, the candidates object will be set to a value, each ballot will have a unique ID, and each ballot will be written to the temporary file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for opening / closing files.

      • setCandidates

        public java.lang.String setCandidates(java.lang.String header)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method takes the first line from the first file as the list of candidates. It parses the candidates and sets the value of candidates to include each respective candidate.
        Parameters:
        header - - string of candidates, separated by commas
        Returns:
        String value of the candidate line that appears in the audit file for testing.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for opening / closing files.

      • addBallotToList

        public Ballot addBallotToList(java.lang.String record)
        This method creates a new ballot object created from a line from the files containing the ballots, and adds it to the ballot list.
        Parameters:
        record - - ballot line from the ballot files.
        Returns:
        ballot object to be written to the temporary audit file.

      • writeToAudit

        protected void writeToAudit(Ballot bal,
                            java.lang.String description)
        This method writes a description, along with the associated ballot to the temporary audit file. This is used while creating both the original readings of ballots as well as during processing by STV and Plurality classes.
        Parameters:
        bal - - ballot to be written
        description - - description that prefixes the ballot

      • writeToAudit

        protected void writeToAudit(java.lang.String description)
        This is an overloaded method, accepting only a description. This method is to be used by STV or Plurality when only a description is needed to be written to the audit file.
        Parameters:
        description - - description of what happened during election processing.

      • writeFinalResults

        public void writeFinalResults()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes the final results of the election to the audit file. It contains all pertinent information to the election: type of election, number of seats, number of candidates, number of ballots, the winners, the losers, etc. The final audit file is saved in "VotingSystem_AuditFile_Group1.txt"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for opening / closing files.

      • setAuditWriter

        protected java.lang.String setAuditWriter(boolean alwaysSet)
        This method is used to set the audit writer to write to the correct file. If testing, it will write to the test file location, otherwise it will write to the temporary file
        Parameters:
        alwaysSet - - decide if we should always be setting a new audit writer.
        Returns:
        string value to indicate where the audit writer is set. Used for testing.
